Cranberry Yogurt Parfait

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking for a quick, nutritious, and delicious breakfast or snack option, look no further than this delightful Cranberry Yogurt Parfait. Packed with the creamy goodness of Greek yogurt, the tartness of cranberry sauce, and the crunchy texture of granola, this parfait is not only visually appealing but also bursting with flavor. With just a few simple ingredients, including Greek yogurt, cranberry sauce, and granola, you can create a satisfying treat that’s perfect for any time of day. This recipe is not only easy to prepare but also customizable; feel free to add layers of your favorite fruits or nuts. Whether you're serving it at a brunch gathering or enjoying it solo, this Cranberry Yogurt Parfait is sure to impress. Join us as we explore how to make this healthy parfait that combines taste and nutrition in every delicious bite!

Ingredients

greek yogurt

Choose full-fat Greek yogurt for a creamier texture, or opt for low-fat if you're looking for a lighter option. You can substitute it with regular yogurt, but the consistency will be thinner. To enhance the flavor, consider adding a splash of vanilla extract or a pinch of cinnamon.

cranberry sauce

If you prefer less sugar, use unsweetened cranberry sauce or make your own by simmering fresh cranberries with a bit of water and a sweetener of your choice. You can also substitute cranberry sauce with other fruit preserves like raspberry or cherry for a different flavor profile.

granola

Select a granola that is not overly sweet, as the honey and cranberry sauce will add enough sweetness. You can substitute it with oats for a gluten-free option or use nuts and seeds if you're looking for a crunch without the carbs. Toasting the granola slightly in the oven can enhance its flavor.

honey

If you're looking for a vegan alternative, agave syrup or maple syrup can be used instead of honey. Adjust the amount based on your sweetness preference, and consider adding a hint of lemon juice to balance the sweetness.

fresh cranberries (optional for garnish)

Fresh cranberries add a tart contrast to the sweetness of the parfait. If you cannot find fresh cranberries, pomegranate seeds can be a great substitute for color and tartness. When using fresh cranberries, consider slightly sweetening them with sugar or honey to enhance their flavor.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare Your Ingredients

    Gather all your ingredients: 2 cups of Greek yogurt, 1 cup of cranberry sauce, 1 cup of granola, 2 tablespoons of honey, and 1/4 cup of fresh cranberries (optional for garnish). It's important to have everything ready before you start assembling your parfait.

  • Step 2: First Layer - Greek Yogurt

    In a clear glass or bowl, start by adding a generous layer of Greek yogurt at the bottom. This will be the base of your parfait. Greek yogurt is packed with protein and gives a creamy texture. For a smoother consistency, you can whisk the yogurt briefly before adding.

  • Step 3: Second Layer - Cranberry Sauce

    Next, spoon a layer of cranberry sauce over the yogurt. Use homemade or store-bought cranberry sauce—whichever you prefer. This layer adds a tart flavor that complements the creaminess of the yogurt. Make sure to spread it evenly.

  • Step 4: Third Layer - Granola

    Sprinkle a layer of granola on top of the cranberry sauce. Granola adds a crunchy texture and additional flavor. Choose your favorite granola, preferably one that is low in added sugars to keep the parfait healthy.

  • Step 5: Repeat the Layers

    Continue to repeat the layers of Greek yogurt, cranberry sauce, and granola until the glasses are filled to your desired height. Finish with a final layer of granola on top for presentation. This layering technique not only looks appealing but also ensures a balanced flavor in every bite.

  • Step 6: Add Sweetness - Honey Drizzle

    Drizzle 2 tablespoons of honey over the top layer of granola. This step is optional, but it enhances the sweetness of the parfait. You can adjust the amount of honey based on your taste preference. For a healthier option, consider using maple syrup or agave nectar.

  • Step 7: Garnish with Fresh Cranberries

    If desired, garnish your parfait with 1/4 cup of fresh cranberries on top. This adds a pop of color and a fresh burst of flavor. Fresh cranberries can be slightly tart, so use them according to your taste.

  • Step 8: Serve and Enjoy

    Your cranberry yogurt parfait is now ready to serve! Enjoy it as a healthy breakfast, a delicious snack, or a delightful dessert. This parfait can be made ahead of time and stored in the refrigerator for a few hours, but it’s best enjoyed fresh.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to layer ingredients in a parfait?

Start with Greek yogurt at the bottom, followed by cranberry sauce, and then granola. Repeat these layers until you reach the top of your glass or bowl. Finish with a layer of granola for a nice crunch.

Can I use store-bought cranberry sauce?

Absolutely! Store-bought cranberry sauce is a convenient option and still delicious. You can also make your own if you prefer a fresh taste.

How can I make my parfait healthier?

You can use low-fat Greek yogurt, reduce the amount of granola, or add fresh fruits like bananas or berries for extra nutrients without added sugars.

What type of granola should I use?

Choose a granola that you enjoy! Look for one with whole grains and nuts for added health benefits. If you're feeling adventurous, you can even make your own.

Do I need to use fresh cranberries for garnish?

Fresh cranberries are optional for garnish. They add a pop of color and a tart flavor, but you can skip them if you prefer. Dried cranberries could also work!

How can I make this parfait ahead of time?

You can prepare the yogurt, cranberry sauce, and granola separately and layer them just before serving. This prevents the granola from getting soggy.

What kitchen tools do I need to make a parfait?

You’ll need a glass or bowl for layering, a spoon for scooping, and a measuring cup for the ingredients. A small whisk can be handy for drizzling honey evenly.

Can I substitute Greek yogurt with another type of yogurt?

Yes, you can use regular yogurt, dairy-free yogurt, or any yogurt you prefer. Just keep in mind that the texture and flavor might vary.

How long can I store leftover parfait?

If you have leftovers, store them in the fridge for up to 2 days, but note that the granola may lose its crunch.

What is a good way to sweeten the yogurt without using honey?

You can use maple syrup, agave nectar, or even a bit of vanilla extract to sweeten your yogurt naturally.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This parfait can be made dairy-free by substituting Greek yogurt with coconut or almond yogurt. For a gluten-free option, use gluten-free granola. Adjust the sweetness by reducing the honey or using a sugar substitute for a low-calorie option. This dish is suitable for vegetarian diets and can be made vegan with the appropriate yogurt and sweetener.

Pairings

Pair the Cranberry Yogurt Parfait with a warm cup of spiced chai or a cold glass of apple cider for a delightful contrast of flavors. For a more indulgent pairing, consider serving with a slice of almond or pumpkin bread. If you're looking for a protein boost, serve alongside a handful of mixed nuts or a cheese platter with mild cheeses like brie or camembert.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the parfaits in clear glass cups to showcase the beautiful layers of yogurt, cranberry sauce, and granola. For a brunch or dessert occasion, place them on a tray with a side of fresh mint leaves for a pop of color. Consider adding a sprinkle of cinnamon or nutmeg on top for an aromatic twist, and keep them chilled until serving for a refreshing treat.

Cranberry Yogurt Parfait

10 min
$8
250 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyNuts (if granola contains nuts)

Tags:

BreakfastSnackHealthyQuickEasy

Description

A refreshing and healthy parfait layered with creamy yogurt, tart cranberries, and crunchy granola.

Ingredients

  • greek yogurt: 2 cups
  • cranberry sauce: 1 cup
  • granola: 1 cup
  • honey: 2 tablespoons
  • fresh cranberries (optional for garnish): 1/4 cup
